intro: Lamprotis biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered lamprotis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
